New Records: For the first time in its 55-year history, the Cleveland Cavaliers have kicked off an NBA season with an impressive 9-0 record.
Coach Kenny Atkinson became the first coach in league history to achieve a 9-0 record in his first year with a new team.
The Cavaliers are leading the NBA in field goal percentage with 52.6% so far this season.
The Cavaliers have scored 110 points or more in each of their first nine games, a feat previously accomplished only by the 1960-61 Warriors.
Key Match Events: The Cavaliers defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 131-122 to reach the historic 9-0 mark.
Donovan Mitchell scored 29 points in the game against the Pelicans.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Kenny Atkinson highlighted his team's consistency in all aspects of the game and acknowledged the contribution of each player.
Donovan Mitchell emphasized teamwork and a focus on consistency, praising Atkinson's leadership style.
